Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw different types of habitats, such as land habitats (e.g., playground, garden, forest, parking lot) and water habitats (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can illustrate a variety of living things found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, bushes, flowering plants, lizards, squirrels, ants, fish, and clams.
The student can compare the diversity of living things in different habitats by showing distinct types in each drawing.
The student can identify patterns in plant and animal diversity across different habitats through their illustrations.
